channel.title: Writing crown to Donor status (IsMember)

item.title: Writing crown to Donor status (IsMember)
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude462 sk8rdude462
item.description:
@sk8rdude462 wrote:

[quote=“pat can pk, post:8, topic:423252”]Alright, what you gotta do is in your source files, go to data/characters(something like that). Basically, go into your character files folder and click the person’s name. In the notepad, it’ll say something like isDonator = 0 or isMember = 0

Make those 0’s into a 1 and save.

But make sure that the person you’re editing is OFFLINE, OR ELSE THIS WILL NOT WORK!

Hope this helped[/quote]

… You mis understood what I meant. I have that part done. I need it to out.write so the client can read that the person is a donor…

Read full topic

item.title: Writing crown to Donor status (IsMember)
item.dc:creator: @pat_can_pk pat can pk
item.description:
@pat_can_pk wrote:

Alright, what you gotta do is in your source files, go to data/characters(something like that). Basically, go into your character files folder and click the person’s name. In the notepad, it’ll say something like isDonator = 0 or isMember = 0

Make those 0’s into a 1 and save.

But make sure that the person you’re editing is OFFLINE, OR ELSE THIS WILL NOT WORK!

Hope this helped

Read full topic

item.title: Writing crown to Donor status (IsMember)
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude462 sk8rdude462
item.description:
@sk8rdude462 wrote:

So my donor status is IsMember. Just easier for me to use this instead of making a new right or any of that. I have the client side mostly figured out. (there is a topic in client help :P) I need to know how to make the server out.write (hint hint) that someone IsMember 1 or 2 then for the client to show the correct icon (donor1/donor2)
This is a snippit I found in my server that might be useful but I have no clue:

[code] checkmembers();
if (checkmembers() == 5)
{
playerIsMember = 1;
}
if (checkmembers() == 0)
{
playerIsMember = 0;
}
if (playerId == -1)
{
out.write(7);
} // “This world is full.”
else
{
out.write(returnCode);
} // login response (1: wait 2seconds, 2=login successfull, 4=ban
if (playerRights == 3)
{
out.write(2); // Crown fixup
}
else
{
out.write(playerRights); // mod level
}

		out.write(0); // no log
	}[/code]

Read full topic
